Service Details: - Accepts and administers money from donors such as community or school groups, businesses, and individuals and provides financial assistance to our Grade 12 graduates in order that they may further their post-secondary education- Acts as a central body through which graduating Grade 12 students can apply for approximately 500 bursaries and scholarships- Intended for students entering a college, university or other post- secondary institution in the coming year
Eligibility: Criteria for these awards are set by the donor to recognize student achievement (for example: citizenship, scholastic achievement, athletic achievement), and to assist those who might find difficulty in financing further education
